org.gearvrf.asynchronous

Class GVRCompressedTextureLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.asynchronous.GVRCompressedTextureLoader

  • public abstract class GVRCompressedTextureLoader
extends java.lang.Object
    Implement this class to use compressed texture formats that GVRF does not support. A GVRCompressedTextureLoader contains the logic to detect a particular file type, and to parse the header. It is an abstract class (not an interface) so that it can contain a protected method ( CompressedTexture()) that calls the private CompressedTexture constructor: this limits the chances that someone will create an instance with invalid value, while still allowing apps to add new loaders without having to add them to this package.

    The general data flow is

    • The internal load method loads the file into memory
    • If one and only one sniff() method returns true, the data is passed to the corresponding parse() method
    • The parse() method extracts GL parameters, and uses CompressedTexture() to return an internal CompressedTexture instance
    • The internal load method passes that CompressedTexture to a GL-thread callback, that converts it to a texture and passes that texture to the app's BitmapTextureCallback
    Since:
    1.6.1

    • Method Detail

      • headerLength

        public abstract int headerLength()
        Bytes of header data that we need to sniff(byte[], Reader) or parse(byte[], Reader). When we know that a file contains a compressed texture, we can simply load the whole thing into a byte[], and pass the offset of the actual data to CompressedTexture(int, int, int, int, int, byte[], int, int). But, when a file may contain either an Android Bitmap or a compressed texture, we don't want to load the whole file into memory: BitmapFactory#decodeStream(InputStream) is more memory-efficient than BitmapFactory#decodeByteArray(byte[], int, int).
        Returns:
        Number of bytes of header data needed to successfully sniff or parse the file format.
        Since:
        1.6.6

      • sniff

        public abstract boolean sniff(byte[] data,
                              org.gearvrf.asynchronous.GVRCompressedTextureLoader.Reader reader)
        Does this byte array contain an instance of 'my' compressed texture? The load() methods will call all registered Loader's sniffers: if one and only one returns true, the load() method will return a CompressedTexture.

        Note: This routine needs to be very fast! The load() routine will call all registered sniffers, rather than looking at (possibly invalid) file extensions, or asking the user for a (possibly invalid) hint.

        Parameters:
        data - A compressed texture file's contents
        reader - A data reader, pointing to data[0]
        Returns:
        Whether or not this data is in 'my' format

      • parse

        public abstract org.gearvrf.asynchronous.CompressedTexture parse(byte[] data,
                                                                 org.gearvrf.asynchronous.GVRCompressedTextureLoader.Reader reader)
        Parse the header, and return a CompressedTexture. This will only be called if the loader's sniff(byte[], Reader) function returned true.
        Parameters:
        data - A compressed texture file's contents: this loader's sniff(byte[], Reader) function has already returned true.
        reader - A data reader, pointing to data[0]
        Returns:
        A CompressedTexture, from CompressedTexture(int, int, int, int, int, byte[], int, int)

      • register

        public void register()
        Register a loader with the 'sniffer'. 'Factory loaders' are pre-registered. To load a format we don't support, create a GVRCompressedTextureLoader descendant. Then, before trying to load any files in that format, create an instance and call register(): 
         
 new MyCompressedFormat().register();
